title: Understanding z-index
summary: In the most basic cases, HTML pages can be considered two-dimensional, because text, images, and other elements are arranged on the page without overlapping. In this case, there is a single rendering flow, and all elements are aware of the space taken by others. The z-index attribute lets you adjust the order of the layering of objects when rendering content.
pageTitle: Understanding z-index - CSS: Cascading Style Sheets | MDN
